alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 2:45PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN WAYNE COUNTY THROUGH 315 PM EDT... At 245 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near New Castle, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph, half inch hail, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Hagerstown, Franklin, Economy and Williamsburg. This includes I-70 in Indiana between mile markers 134 and 135. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for east central Indiana. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
